heading: Simple Future Tense and Future Continuous Tense

topics.heading: Simple Future Tense and Future Continuous Tense

questions.question: Which sentence uses simple future tense?

options.text: I will eat an apple tomorrow.

questions.explanation: The simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb to talk about something that will happen in the future. 'I will eat' shows a future action.

questions.question: What is the future continuous form of 'play'?
questions.explanation: The future continuous tense is formed with 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb. It shows an action that will be happening over some time in the future.

questions.question: Which sentence uses future continuous tense?

options.text: I will go to the park.
I will be going to the park.

questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (going), which is the structure for future continuous tense. It shows an action that will be in progress in the future.

questions.question:
In the sentence
'They ____ basketball tomorrow afternoon,'
which option completes it in simple future tense?
questions.explanation: The simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will play' correctly shows a future action that will happen tomorrow afternoon.

questions.question: What is the simple future tense of 'learn'?
questions.explanation: The simple future tense is formed with 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will learn' correctly shows a future action.

questions.question:
In the sentence
'She ____ a new dress for the party,'
which option completes it in simple future tense?
questions.explanation: The simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will wear' correctly shows a future action that will happen at the party.

questions.question: Which sentence uses future continuous tense?

options.text: We play in the park every Saturday.
We will play in the park next Saturday.
We will be playing in the park all afternoon.
We played in the park last Saturday.

questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (playing), which is the structure for future continuous tense. It shows an action that will be ongoing for some time (all afternoon) in the future.

questions.question: What is the future continuous form of 'read'?
questions.explanation: The future continuous tense is formed with 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb. 'Will be reading' shows an action that will be in progress in the future.

questions.question: 'I will eating dinner at 7 PM' is the correct future tense.
questions.explanation: The correct form would be 'I will be eating dinner at 7 PM' (future continuous) or 'I will eat dinner at 7 PM' (simple future).

questions.question: Which sentence uses simple future tense?

options.text: I will read a book tonight.

questions.explanation: The simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb to talk about something that will happen in the future. 'I will read' shows a future action planned for tonight.

questions.question:
'They will be playing soccer this weekend'
is in the future continuous tense.
questions.explanation: It uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (playing), which is the proper structure for future continuous tense.

questions.question: What is the future continuous form of 'dance'?
questions.explanation: The future continuous tense is formed with 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb. It shows an action that will be happening over a period of time in the future.

questions.question: 'The movie will start at 8 PM' is in simple future tense.
questions.explanation: It uses 'will' + the base form of the verb (start), which is the proper structure for simple future tense.

questions.question: Which sentence uses future continuous tense?

options.text: They will be playing chess all afternoon.

questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (playing), which is the structure for future continuous tense. It shows an action that will be in progress for a specific time (all afternoon) in the future.

questions.question:
In the sentence
'The dog ____ in the garden tomorrow,'
which option completes it in simple future tense?
questions.explanation: The simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will run' correctly shows a future action that will happen tomorrow.

questions.question: Which sentence is in future continuous tense?

options.text: The sun will be shining all day.

questions.explanation: This sentence uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (shining), which is the correct structure for future continuous tense. It shows an action that will be ongoing throughout the day in the future.

questions.question: Next month, we ____ (move) to a new house.
questions.explanation: In simple future tense, we use 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will move' shows a planned future action for next month.

questions.question: 'The children will playing in the park tomorrow' is the correct future tense.
questions.explanation: The correct form would be 'The children will be playing in the park tomorrow' (future continuous) or 'The children will play in the park tomorrow' (simple future).

questions.question: 'We will be visiting the museum next week' is in the future continuous tense.
questions.explanation: It uses 'will be' + the '-ing' form of the verb (visiting), which is the proper structure for future continuous tense.

questions.question: The sun ____ (shine) all day tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Simple future tense uses 'will' + the base form of the verb. 'Will shine' predicts a future action that will last all day tomorrow.
